fields.name: Crystal Malt: 10
fields.description: Sweet, mild caramel flavor and a golden color. Use in light lagers and light ales

fields.name: Crystal Malt: 20
fields.description: Sweet, mild caramel flavor and a golden color. Use in light lagers and light ales

fields.name: Crystal Malt: 30
fields.description: Sweet, mild caramel flavor and a golden color. Use in light lagers and light ales

fields.name: Crystal Malt: 40
fields.description: Sweet, mild caramel flavor and a light red color. Use in red and amber ales

fields.name: Crystal Malt: 60
fields.description: Sweet caramel flavor, deep golden to red color. For dark amber or brown ales

fields.name: Crystal Malt: 80
fields.description: Sweet, smooth caramel flavor and a red to deep red color. For porters, old ales.

fields.name: Crystal Malt: 90
fields.description: Pronounced caramel flavor and a red color. For stouts, porters and black beers.

fields.name: Crystal Malt: 120
fields.description: Pronounced caramel flavor and a red color. For stouts, porters and black beers.

fields.name: Black Patent Malt
fields.description: Provides color and sharp flavor in stouts and porters.

fields.name: Roasted Barley
fields.description: Sweet, grainy, coffee flavor and a red to deep brown color. For porters and stouts.

fields.name: Black Barley
fields.description: Imparts dryness. Unmalted; use in porters and dry stouts.

fields.name: Chocolate Malt
fields.description: Use in all types to adjust color and add nutty, toasted flavor. Chocolate flavor.

fields.name: Dextrin Malt (carapils)
fields.description: Balances body and flavor without adding color, aids in head retention. For any beer.

fields.name: Pale Malt (2-row)
fields.description: Smooth, less grainy, moderate malt flavor. Basic malt for all beer styles.

fields.name: Pale Malt (6-row)
fields.description: Moderate malt flavor. Basic malt for all beer styles.

fields.name: Munich Malt
fields.description: Sweet, toasted flavor and aroma. For Oktoberfests and malty styles.

fields.name: Special Roast
fields.description: Provides a deep golden to brown color for ales. Use in all darker ales.

fields.name: Vienna Malt
fields.description: Increases malty flavor, provides balance. Use in Vienna, Marzen and Oktoberfest.

fields.name: Victory Malt
fields.description: Provides a deep golden to brown color. Use in nut brown ales, IPAs and Scottish ales.

fields.name: Wheat Malt
fields.description: Light flavor and creamy head. For American weizenbier, weissbier and dunkelweiss

fields.name: White Wheat Malt
fields.description: Imparts a malty flavor. For American wheat beers, wheat bock and doppel bock.

fields.name: Aromatic Malt
fields.description: Imparts a big malt aroma. Use in brown ales, Belgian dubbels and triples.

fields.name: Biscuit Malt
fields.description: Warm baked biscuit flavor and aroma. Increases body. Use in Belgian beers.

fields.name: Caramunich Malt
fields.description: Caramel, full flavor, copper color. For Belgian ales, German smoked and bocks.

fields.name: Caravienne Malt
fields.description: Belgian light crystal malt. Used in lighter Abbey or Trappist style ales.

fields.name: Pale Ale Malt
fields.description: Use as a base malt for any Belgian style beer with full body.

fields.name: Pilsen Malt
fields.description: Light color, malty flavor. For pilsners, dubbels, tripels, whites and specialty ales.

fields.name: Special B Malt
fields.description: Extreme caramel aroma and flavor. For dark Abbey beers and other dark beers.

fields.name: Amber Malt
fields.description: Roasted malt used in British milds, old ales, brown ales, nut brown ales.

fields.name: Brown Malt
fields.description: Imparts a dry, biscuit flavor. Use in porters, brown, nut brown and Belgian ales.

fields.name: Maris Otter Pale Malt
fields.description: Premium base malt for any beer. Good for pale ales.

fields.name: Pale Ale
fields.description: Moderate malt flavor. Used to produce traditional English and Scottish style ales.

fields.name: Lager Malt
fields.description: Used to make light colored and flavored lagers.

fields.name: Crystal Malt
fields.description: Sweet caramel flavor, adds mouthfeel and head retention. For pale or amber ales.

fields.name: Dark Crystal Malt
fields.description: Sweet caramel flavor, adds mouthfeel and head retention. For pale or amber ales.

fields.name: Mild Ale Malt
fields.description: Dry, nutty malty flavor. Promotes body. Use in English mild ales.

fields.name: Cara-Pils Dextrin
fields.description: Adds body; aids head retention. For porters, stouts and heavier bodied beers.

fields.name: Chocolate Malt
fields.description: Nutty, toasted flavor, brown color. Use in porters, stouts, brown ales and dark lagers.

fields.name: Black Patent Malt
fields.description: Dry, burnt, chalky character. Use in porters, stouts, brown ales and dark lagers.

fields.name: Peat Smoked Malt
fields.description: Imparts a robust smoky flavor and aroma. For Scottish ales and wee heavies.

fields.name: Roasted Barley
fields.description: Dry, roasted flavor, amber color. For stouts, porters, and Scottish ales.

fields.name: Toasted Pale Malt
fields.description: Imparts nutty flavor and aroma. Use in IPAs and Scottish ales.

fields.name: Wheat Malt
fields.description: Light flavor, creamy head. For wheat beers, stouts, dopplebocks and alt beers.

fields.name: Torrified Wheat
fields.description: Puffed wheat created by hight heat. Use in pale ales, bitters and milds.

fields.name: Acidulated (Sauer) Malt
fields.description: High lactic acid. For lambics, sour mash beers, Irish stout, pilsners and wheats.

fields.name: Carafa I
fields.description: Gives a deep aroma and color to dark beers, bocks, stout, alt and schwarzbier.

fields.name: Carafa II
fields.description: Carafa I, II and III also are available de-husked. Adds aroma, color and body.

fields.name: Chocolate Wheat Malt
fields.description: Intensifies aroma; improves color. For dark ales, alt, dark wheat, stout and porter.

fields.name: Chocolate Rye Malt
fields.description: Enhances aroma of dark ales and improves color. For dunkel rye wheat and ale.

fields.name: CaraHell Malt (light crystal)
fields.description: For light colored beer for body; hefeweizen, pale ale, golden ale, Oktoberfest.

fields.name: CaraMunich Malt I
fields.description: Provides body. For Oktoberfest, bock, porter, stout, red, amber and brown ales.

fields.name: CaraMunich Malt III
fields.description: CaraMunich Malt III is dark crystal.

fields.name: Light Munich Malt
fields.description: FOr a desired malty, nutty flavor. Lagers, Oktoberfest and bock beer.

fields.name: Dark Munich Malt
fields.description: Enhances body and aroma. Stout, schwarzbier, brown ale, dark and amber ales.

fields.name: Melanoidin Malt
fields.description: For amber lagers and ales, dark lagers and ales, Scottish & red ales.

fields.name: Rauch Smoked Malt
fields.description: For rauchbier, kellerbier, smoked porters, Scottish ales and barleywines.

fields.name: Rye Malt
fields.description: Dry character. Can use as a base malt. For seasonal beers, roggenbier and ales.

fields.name: Wheat Malt Light
fields.description: Typical top fermented aroma, produces superb wheat beers.

fields.name: Caramel Wheat Malt
fields.description: For dark ales, hefeweizen, dunkelweizen, wheat bocks and doppelbocks.

fields.name: Gambrinus Honey Malt
fields.description: Nutty honey flavor. For brown ales, Belgian wheats, bocks and many other styles.

fields.name: Scotmalt Golden Promise
fields.description: Scottish pale ale malt; base malt for all Scottish beers.

fields.name: Flaked Barley
fields.description: Helps head retention, imparts creamy smoothness. For porters and stouts.

fields.name: Flaked Maize
fields.description: Lightens body and color. For light American pilsners and ales.

fields.name: Flaked Oats
fields.description: Adds body and creamy head. FOr stouts and oat ales.

fields.name: Flaked Rye
fields.description: Imparts a dry, crisp character. Use in rye beers.

fields.name: Grits
fields.description: Imparts a corn/grain taste. Use in American lagers.

fields.name: Irish Moss
fields.description: Prevents chill haze. Use in all beers except cloudy wheat and white beers.

fields.name: Malto Dextrin
fields.description: Adds body and mouthfeel. For all extract beers. Does not ferment.

fields.name: Oak Chips
fields.description: Creates cask-conditioned flavor and aroma. Use in IPAs, Belgian ales and SCottish ales. Steam for 15 minutes to sanitize.

fields.name: Candi Sugar: clear
fields.description: Smooth taste, good head retention, sweet aroma and high gravity without being apparent. Use in Belgian and holiday ales. Use for Tripels.

fields.name: Candi Sugar: amber
fields.description: Smooth taste, good head retention, sweet aroma and high gravity without being apparent. Use in Belgian and holiday ales. Use for dubbels.

fields.name: Candi Sugar: dark
fields.description: Smooth taste, good head retention, sweet aroma and high gravity without being apparent. Use in Belgian and holiday ales. Use for brown beer and strong golden ales.

fields.name: Brown Sugar
fields.description: Imparts rich, sweet flavor. Use in Scottish ales, old ales and holiday beers.

fields.name: Dark Brown Sugar
fields.description: Imparts rich, sweet flavor. Use in Scottish ales, old ales and holiday beers.

fields.name: Corn Sugar
fields.description: Use in priming beer or in extract recipes where flaked maize would be used in a mash

fields.name: Demerara Sugar
fields.description: Imparts mellow, sweet flavor. Use in English ales.

fields.name: Dextrose (glucose)
fields.description: Imparts a mild sweet taste and smoothness. Use in English beers.

fields.name: Honey
fields.description: Imparts sweet and dry taste. For honey and brown ales. Also: specialty ales

fields.name: Invert Sugar
fields.description: Increases alcohol. Use in some Belgian or English ales. Use as an adjunct for priming. Made from sucrose. No dextrins. Use 1 cup for priming.

fields.name: Lactose
fields.description: Adds sweetness and body. Use in sweet or milk stouts.

fields.name: Licorice Stick
fields.description: Adds a smooth flavor to stouts, porters, holiday ales and flavored beers.

fields.name: Lyle's Golden Syrup
fields.description: Increases alcohol without flavor. Liquid Invert Sugar. Use in English and Belgain (Chimay) ales.

fields.name: Maple syrup
fields.description: Imparts a dry, woodsy flavor if used in the boil. If beer is blottled with it, it gives it a smooth sweet, maple taste. Use in maple ales, pale ales, brown ales and porters.

fields.name: Maple Sap
fields.description: Crisp dry, earthy flavor. Use in pale ales, porters and maple ales.

fields.name: Molasses: Light
fields.description: Imparts strong sweet flavor. Use in stouts and porters.

fields.name: Molasses: Dark
fields.description: Imparts strong sweet flavor. Use in stouts and porters.

fields.name: Rice Solids
fields.description: Lightens flavor without taste. Use in American and Asian lagers.

fields.name: Sucrose (white table sugar)
fields.description: Increases alcohol. Use in Australian lagers and Engish bitters.

fields.name: Liquid Malt Extract: Extra Light
fields.description: Extra Light (3.5L), Light (3.5-5L), Amber (10L), Dark (30L), Wheat (2L).

fields.name: Liquid Malt Extract: Light
fields.description: Extra Light (3.5L), Light (3.5-5L), Amber (10L), Dark (30L), Wheat (2L).

fields.name: Liquid Malt Extract: Amber
fields.description: Extra Light (3.5L), Light (3.5-5L), Amber (10L), Dark (30L), Wheat (2L).

fields.name: Liquid Malt Extract: Dark
fields.description: Extra Light (3.5L), Light (3.5-5L), Amber (10L), Dark (30L), Wheat (2L).

fields.name: Liquid Malt Extract: Wheat
fields.description: Extra Light (3.5L), Light (3.5-5L), Amber (10L), Dark (30L), Wheat (2L).

fields.name: Treacle
fields.description: Imparts intense, sweet flavor. A British mixture of molasses, invert sugar and golden syrup (corn syrup). Use in dark English ales.
